messages.message: For people seeing this problem, no need to clear cache and cookies, but you do need to hard refresh - cmd + shift + r
CMD+SHIFT+R does work. However you need to do it once per app.
Hm I had to do this at the beginning of the week and didn’t have that experience, is anyone else seeing that you have to do it once per app?
It's not even once per app - it works a few times and then again blank screen - let me send a screen recording
It is quite flaky - you can see it in this
I am hitting CMD+SHIFT+R each time - except when i refresh from the browser
And the console isn’t showing anything?
It does show an error - I hvae posted it in <#CLBGA5A7K|>
Cool I'm able to reproduce this now - will look into it asap and would appreciate if other frontend people want to do their own research too!
@Anil, can you try again right now? nginx has been redeployed and we're hoping that fixes the problem for now
nope - still seeing the issue
I can't reproduce on prod anymore - can you try hard refreshing a couple of times?

I see - I still see it on instabase.com (http://instabase.com)
I am off for a while - getting my vaccine shot - can check back later
I generally don't use instabase.com (http://instabase.com) - so not an issue for me :wink:
@Jessica I am still seeing this issue on prod
And have to do cmd shift R to get it to work, but did that a couple times for the app already (in this case OCR Review)

```Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'call' of undefined
    at l (ibvendors.bundle.js?v=1619703744.9413302:1)
    at Object.154 (ibapp_ocr_review_batch.bundle.js?v=1619703744.9413302:6)
    at l (ibvendors.bundle.js?v=1619703744.9413302:1)
    at Object.66 (ibapp_ocr_review_batch.bundle.js?v=1619703744.9413302:117)
    at l (ibvendors.bundle.js?v=1619703744.9413302:1)
    at Object.151 (ibapp_ocr_review_batch.bundle.js?v=1619703744.9413302:6)
    at l (ibvendors.bundle.js?v=1619703744.9413302:1)
    at Module.1759 (ibapp_ocr_review_batch.bundle.js?v=1619703744.9413302:31)
    at l (ibvendors.bundle.js?v=1619703744.9413302:1)
    at n (ibvendors.bundle.js?v=1619703744.9413302:1)```
I’ll be on in two minutes
John St has a potential fix we're trying to cherry pick in
I think this is what’s going on: https://github.com/webpack/webpack/pull/8916
Although this should be fixed in our current version of webpack but one potential solution is turning off module concatenation
We are going to try this
There is also another thread around sideEffects and how webpack handles those that could also be the issue
I haven’t been able to repro this issue locally so it’s hard to tell what exactly the issue is and what will solve it
But based off the error we are all seeing in the console it could be one of these solutions
i can confirm that this is happening intermittently on prod.. i tired hard refresh, sometimes it works and somtimes it doesn’t @@
